16.text:
I study translation interpreting, I'm
doing an exchange program here.

22.text: I looked on the website that UWS has the best

27.text: translation and interpreting major in Australia, so I applied here.

31.text:
Before I came to Australia,I always
saw Australia as a country full of

36.text: white people because it's an English-speaking country

39.text:
But I found out that actually it's
a very diverse country, especially Sydney

47.text:
where people from all kinds of backgrounds
are living here together

51.text: I think it's a good experience to get to know people

55.text:
from different cultures and
everything, and I really love the life here.

59.text:
I was really scared on the first day
because this is the first time that I have

64.text: ever been in an English-speaking country.All the signs

67.text:
in the airport are all written in English,
too much information all at one time.

72.text: When I had contact with several local people here

76.text:
they were so nice and friendly, I feel
a lot more relaxed because I know I can always

82.text: get help. Students here are really welcoming, I learned

85.text: a lot on orientation day from the students here,

90.text: and I also enjoy the MATES program. I had a great mentor he has

95.text: taught me a lot of things about the studying life

99.text:
in uni as well as how to adjust to life here
in Sydney.

104.text: I really appreciate that. The lecturers and tutors are

109.text:
always helpful when they know that I'm
an international exchange student, and also

115.text: Student Central provided a lot of help to me, it's

119.text: actually really comforting to a foreigner like me.

124.text:
The tutor will always require us to do some
group discussions. That actually gave me more

130.text:
opportunities to express myself.
I think that really benefits my learning.

137.text:
I got to experience what it was to be like
a real interpreter because there's so much

145.text: tutor and the lecturer would tell us a lot about

149.text: what would happen if we're actually doing this job,

153.text:
so it actually prepared myself
as an interpreter in the future, and benefits

160.text: my future career. I had many

163.text:
options about accommodation here but I ended
up choosing to

167.text:
live on campus. I live in a four-bedroom villa.
This is new to me, I never lived

174.text:
with another person before, and it's nice
to have each others' back

179.text:
whenever we need help, so it's a great experience.
There's a common room on campus for all the

186.text: residents here and people get to be social,

191.text: make friends and spend some leisure time together.

195.text: During the travel I met a lot of people and learned a lot

200.text: from their life experience. It's more rewarding than just

204.text: learning, actually! I want to say thanks to all the

207.text:
people that I've met here
because they're always ready to help me

211.text: and also they make my life more interesting.
